intro: Hieracium ganeschinii, commonly known as the Ganeschin's hawkweed, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its yellow-orange flowers are surrounded by pale green ray florets, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
